articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces deepened their incursion into two northern and southern areas of the Gaza Strip on Friday, and Palestinian health officials said tank shelling in Rafah killed at least 11 people.
articles.title: Israeli forces push deeper into southern and northern Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military's pier off Gaza has once again been removed because of sea conditions, the Pentagon said on Friday, adding it did not make sense for it to return until aid is moved from a nearby marshalling area to people in Gaza.
articles.title: US military pier removed from Gaza coast because of sea conditions again, Pentagon says

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote for a new president on Friday following Ebrahim Raisi's death in a helicopter crash, choosing from a tightly controlled group of four candidates loyal to the supreme leader, at a time of growing public frustration.
articles.title: Iran holds presidential vote with limited choices

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russia would resume production of short and medium range nuclear-capable land-based missiles due to what he said were moves by the United States to deploy them in both Europe and Asia.
articles.title: Putin says Russia to resume production of nuclear-capable intermediate range missiles

articles.author: David Dolan, Heekyong Yang
articles.description: While the first U.S. presidential debate of the 2024 race dwelled little on foreign policy, a shaky performance by President Joe Biden will have America's allies steeling for the return of Donald Trump, analysts say.
articles.title: Biden's shaky debate has overseas allies bracing for Trump return

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, John Geddie, Hyonhee Shin, Michael Martina
articles.description: Donald Trump's allies are assuring officials in Japan and South Korea that the Republican presidential candidate will support a Biden-era effort to deepen three-way ties aimed at countering China and North Korea, five people familiar with the conversations said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump will encourage Japan, South Korea ties, allies tell foreign officials

articles.author: Aditi Shah, Aditya Kalra
articles.description: A roof collapse at New Delhi's main airport highlights Prime Minister Narendra Modi's challenges to make India a global aviation hub and raises questions about the rapid pace of infrastructure development in India.
articles.title: Delhi airport roof collapse highlights Modi's infrastructure challenges

articles.author: Minwoo Park
articles.description: South Koreans Kim Eun-ha and Park Cho-hyeon would like to get married and have children, a plan that fits in with government ambitions to boost the world's lowest fertility rate.
articles.title: As South Korea's population shrinks, same-sex couples say they can help

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro, Layli Foroudi
articles.description: When a Green party activist was headbutted in the street, his attackers told him there was more to come when the far right's Jordan Bardella wins France's parliamentary election. A Muslim family received a note with similar threats.
articles.title: France's election stokes far-right linked violence

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States, Britain, France confronted Russia at the United Nations Security Council on Friday over accusations it is violating an arms embargo on North Korea by using missiles and munitions from Pyongyang in its war against Ukraine.
articles.title: Global powers clash at United Nations over North Korea
